page.title: 14CHURCHES IN ELLAND
page.content: For hundreds of years the established church had little competition, the Parish Church of St.Mary the Virgin being the only church in Elland. However, there are many church buildings in Ejlland reflecting the Protestant movement and the dissatisfaction felt with the Church of England in the 18th and 19th centuries. A Baptist Church was taken over by the Ranters, Thumpers and Secularists in 1791. It was dem- olished in 1925 for road widening and the stone was used to build the Rising Sun Inn. The Providence Congregational Church opened in 1823, was extended in 1856 and a new church built in 1883. Now called the United Reform Church it is still in use today. Bethesda Church built 1824,gave way to the present buildings of 1880 and continues with regular worship.
